page.title: 11ATLOW MUSHROOM FARM
page.content: There is a mushroom farm in Atlow.It has been a mushroom farm for 12 years. Before that it was a poultry farm. The mushrooms are are grown in nine large sheds.They are grown in compost made from horse dung.They use 20 tons of horse dung per week and that makes 1000 bags of compost.I is dark and humid in the growing sheds.The compost is changed every 12 weeks.The old compost is sold to gardeners at 35p per bag. It takes the mushrooms about 13 days to grow.When they are ready they are like buttons and very white in colour. The farm produces about two or three thousand baskets of mushrooms per week (about 3 tons). To help the farmer 3 full time workers and 13 part-time workers are employed.
